intro: Kochia erioclada, commonly known as the silverleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, powdery hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. Kochia erioclada is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance.
